modName: Brand new start - Skills at level 0
summary: Simple .bat file setting all skills levels to 0.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3]I was looking for a way to set all skills to 0 or any closer and after analyzing / testing this .bat file [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/4121/?]Roleplaying and Harder Start - Skills to Level 1[/url] , I decided to improve it on my own way.

[/size][size=6][u]What has been improved.[/u]
[/size]
[size=3]On his .txt file, the skills level is virtually changed for the 1st level up. (For example, for a base skill level of 20, if you need 1000 XP to go to level 21, you will still need 1000 XP to go from level 1 to level 2 before the game recalculate the XP needed)
[/size]
[size=3]My version basically add some lines in order to "reset" the needed XP by leveling up every Skills and then setting them back to level 0. (So leveling from 0 to 1 will only ask 50 XP for example)
[/size]
[size=6][u]What does it change?
[/u][/size]
[size=3]You'll level up your skills faster and it will be easier to start new skills as they will ask less effort to level up at start.[/size]

[size=6][u]Versions.
[/u][/size]
[size=3]For now there's only 2 versions:

ResetSkill0: Set Player level to 0 with the player XP progression at 18/75 (If you want to start at level 1 simply edit the 1st line to 1, you won't get a perk point but still have XP progression)

ResetSkill1: Set Player level to 1 with no XP progression and a free perk point. (You'll have to [b]upgrade your health to get it back to 100 [/b]due to the level up)

UPDATE: Now there's a .txt file for every races with their main skill at level 18 (instead of 25), secondary skills at 9 (instead of 20) and all the other skills to 0, plus a perk point. (You still have to level up your health to bring it back to 100)

[/size][size=6][u]Install / Uninstall / Compatibility.
[/u][/size]
[size=3]To install and use, simply copy the file into the skyrim/data folder, launch the game, open the console using the [²], [~] or [¬] Key depending on your keyboard and write: bat "name of file" (example: bat ResetArgonian). /!\ You have to wait to control your caracter before entering the bat command otherwise they'll come back to default. /!\

To uninstall, simply delete the .txt file from your Skyrim/data folder.

Since this use basic console commands, this should have a 100% compatibility with every mods and have absolutely no requirement other than Skyrim itself of course ;)

[/size][size=6][u]Creditz.
[/u][/size]
